text: José López Calo (4 February 1922 – 10 May 2020) was a Spanish musicologist. ==Biography== After studying music alongside Manuel Ansola at the Monastery of San Martiño Pinario, he subsequently earned a degree in philosophy at Comillas Pontifical University in 1949. He was ordained a priest in 1951 and graduated from the Faculty of Theology of Granada with a degree in theology in 1956. ==Awards== *Medalla de Oro al mérito en las Bellas Artes (1998) *Premio das Letras e Artes de Galicia (2002) *Premio Fernández-Latorre (2008) ==Works== *La música medieval en Galicia (1982) *Las sonatas de Beethoven para piano (1986) *La música en la Catedral de Santiago (1993) *La música en la Catedral de Plasencia (1995) *La música en la catedral de Burgos (1995) *Historia de la música española (2004) *Documentario musical de la Capilla Real de Granada (2005) *La música en las catedrales españolas (2012) *El miserere de Semana Santa en la Catedral de Sevilla (2015) ==References== ==External links== * Category:1922 births Category:2020 deaths Category:Spanish musicologists Category:Spanish Roman Catholic priests Category:Comillas Pontifical University alumni
title: José López Calo
